p: There are several green microalgae and cyanobacteria such as Tetraspora sp. CU2551, R. rubrum, R. spheroides, Rhodobacter capsulatus, C. vulgaris, C. reinhardtii, Anabaena sp. and Nostoc sp. which have been widely studied for the hydrogen production [ 217, 218, 219, 220]. The model microalga that is usually used for research is the C. reinhardtii since some of its organelles such as mitochondrial, nuclear genomes and chloroplast have been successfully sequenced [ 221].
